item.title: Why We All Scream When We Get Ice Cream Brain Freeze
item.description: July 31, 2017 - When temperatures soar, there's nothing like a frozen treat to take off the edge. But if we dive in too fast, our brains are thrown for a distressing and sometimes painful loop. Here's why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - When temperatures soar, there's nothing like a frozen treat to take off the edge. But if we dive in too fast, our brains are thrown for a distressing and sometimes painful loop. Here's why. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/31/540062185/why-we-all-scream-when-we-get-ice-cream-brain-freeze

item.title: Arizona Republican Hopes Senators Can Work Together On Health Care
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Sen. Jeff Flake says he hopes for bipartisan cooperation on health care after last week's failure to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Sen. Jeff Flake says he hopes for bipartisan cooperation on health care after last week's failure to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/540515353/arizona-republican-hopes-senators-can-work-together-on-health-care

item.title: A Hospital CEO Watches Washington Struggle Over Health Care
item.description: July 31, 2017 - As a provider of both a health care and insurance, Northwell Health has a huge stake in what health care legislation Congress proposes. CEO Michael Dowling says it's time for Democrats and health care professionals to come to the table.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - As a provider of both a health care and insurance, Northwell Health has a huge stake in what health care legislation Congress proposes. CEO Michael Dowling says it's time for Democrats and health care professionals to come to the table. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/540515360/a-hospital-ceo-watches-washington-struggle-over-health-care

item.title: Sperm Counts Plummet In Western Men, Study Finds
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Data from nearly 43,000 men around the world found that sperm counts dropped by more than half in Western countries. It could reflect a decline in health overall, scientists say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Data from nearly 43,000 men around the world found that sperm counts dropped by more than half in Western countries. It could reflect a decline in health overall, scientists say. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/539517210/sperm-counts-plummet-in-western-men-study-finds

item.title: 'Social Camouflage' May Lead To Underdiagnosis Of Autism In Girls
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Girls are much less likely to be diagnosed with autism, but that may be because the signs of the disorder are different than in boys. And girls may be missing out on help as a result.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Girls are much less likely to be diagnosed with autism, but that may be because the signs of the disorder are different than in boys. And girls may be missing out on help as a result. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/31/539123377/social-camouflage-may-lead-to-underdiagnosis-of-autism-in-girls

item.title: Doctors Make The Case Against Taking A Full Course Of Antibiotics
item.description: July 30, 2017 - Some U.K. doctors recently pushed back against the idea of taking a full course of antibiotics. Lulu Garcia-Navarro speaks with doctor Tim Peto, a professor at the University of Oxford.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 30, 2017 - Some U.K. doctors recently pushed back against the idea of taking a full course of antibiotics. Lulu Garcia-Navarro speaks with doctor Tim Peto, a professor at the University of Oxford. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/30/540359356/doctors-make-the-case-against-taking-a-full-course-of-antibiotics

item.title: Scientists Still Seek A Reliable DUI Test For Marijuana
item.description: July 30, 2017 - Coloradans can get arrested for driving while stoned. But with no good roadside tools, officers' determinations are more subjective than for alcohol DUIs. Scientists hope to find chemical markers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 30, 2017 - Coloradans can get arrested for driving while stoned. But with no good roadside tools, officers' determinations are more subjective than for alcohol DUIs. Scientists hope to find chemical markers. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/30/523004450/scientists-still-seek-a-reliable-dui-test-for-marijuana

item.title: How Do Refugee Teens Build Resilience?
item.description:
July 30, 2017 - We often think of resilience as something that comes from within. Syrian youngsters have a different perspective.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/30/540002667/how-do-refugee-teens-build-resilience
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 30, 2017 - We often think of resilience as something that comes from within. Syrian youngsters have a different perspective. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/30/540002667/how-do-refugee-teens-build-resilience

item.title: The Path Forward In Health Care Remains Uncertain For Both Parties
item.description: July 29, 2017 - The failure of the GOP's health care bill in the senate means the Affordable Care Act is still law. NPR's Noel King speaks with Julie Rovner of Kaiser Health News about where things might go now.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 29, 2017 - The failure of the GOP's health care bill in the senate means the Affordable Care Act is still law. NPR's Noel King speaks with Julie Rovner of Kaiser Health News about where things might go now. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/29/540300069/the-path-forward-in-health-care-remains-uncertain-for-both-parties

item.title: NFL, NIH End Partnership For Concussion Research With $16M Unspent
item.description: July 29, 2017 - The relationship has been fraught with disputes about which research should be funded. Four House members have asked NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell whether the league plans to honor its commitment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 29, 2017 - The relationship has been fraught with disputes about which research should be funded. Four House members have asked NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell whether the league plans to honor its commitment. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/29/540238260/nfl-ends-partnership-with-nih-for-concussion-research-with-16m-unspent

item.title: FDA Announces Plan To Cut Level Of Nicotine Allowed In Cigarettes
item.description: July 28, 2017 - The Food and Drug Administration is proposing sweeping changes to how it regulates cigarettes and related products, including reducing the amount of nicotine allowed in tobacco cigarettes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - The Food and Drug Administration is proposing sweeping changes to how it regulates cigarettes and related products, including reducing the amount of nicotine allowed in tobacco cigarettes. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/540088353/fda-announces-plan-to-cut-level-of-nicotine-allowed-in-cigarettes

item.title: From Rats To Humans, A Brain Knows When It Can't Remember
item.description: July 28, 2017 - When we see a familiar face, we know instantly if we can remember that person's name. That's because the human brain has an ability called metamemory. Looks like rats may have that higher power, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - When we see a familiar face, we know instantly if we can remember that person's name. That's because the human brain has an ability called metamemory. Looks like rats may have that higher power, too. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/28/539761740/from-rats-to-humans-a-brain-knows-when-it-cant-remember

item.title: Charlie Gard, Baby Whose Parents Battled Hospital Over Treatment, Dies
item.description: July 28, 2017 - Charlie had a severe genetic disorder with no known cure, and doctors said experimental treatments could cause suffering. He died in a hospice after his parents dropped a legal challenge.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - Charlie had a severe genetic disorder with no known cure, and doctors said experimental treatments could cause suffering. He died in a hospice after his parents dropped a legal challenge. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/28/540033758/charlie-gard-baby-whose-parents-battled-hospital-over-treatment-dies

item.title: Congress Emerges From Another Health Care Failure Without A Clear Path Forward
item.description: July 28, 2017 - Whether Republicans will try to resurrect health care efforts — again — is uncertain. Republican Sen. John McCain, who cast the decisive no vote, said the bill's defeat is a chance to "start fresh."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - Whether Republicans will try to resurrect health care efforts — again — is uncertain. Republican Sen. John McCain, who cast the decisive no vote, said the bill's defeat is a chance to "start fresh." http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/540021021/congress-emerges-from-another-health-care-failure-without-a-clear-path-forward

item.title: Dutch-Led Fund Raises $300 Million To Replace U.S. Funding For Sexual Health
item.description: July 28, 2017 - In March, the "She Decides" initiative announced $190 million for charities that would lose U.S. support under the Trump administration's anti-abortion policy. Since then, money has kept pouring in.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - In March, the "She Decides" initiative announced $190 million for charities that would lose U.S. support under the Trump administration's anti-abortion policy. Since then, money has kept pouring in. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/539991817/dutch-led-fund-raises-300-million-to-replace-u-s-funding-for-sexual-health
